info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 1:12PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Rutland and southeastern Windsor Counties through 200 PM EDT... At 112 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Ludlow Village, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Chester, Woodstock, Hartland Four Corners, Windsor, Ludlow, Cavendish, Andover, Ludlow Village, Perkinsville Village, Ascutney, Hartland, Reading, Baltimore, Weathersfield, West Windsor, Springfield, Weston, Hartford, Mount Holly and Perkinsville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 89 near mile marker 1. Interstate 91 between mile markers 46 and 70. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for southern Vermont.
